newsitem.title: USA: Montana Power to install automated meters.
newsitem.headline: Montana Power to install automated meters.

text.p: Montana Power Co (MPC) said Tuesday it will install a $20-million mobile automated meter-reading system to upgrade service for its electric and natural gas customers, and to become more competitive.
"(An automated system) provides improved customer service through accuracy and reliability, and it provides a platform for future services," Bob Gannon, MPC president, said in a statement.
Using the technology also will allow Montana Power to market meter-reading services to other utilities providing water, electricity or gas.
The utility said it will begin converting to the new metering system in July, and expects to complete the process in two years.

"We will actively pursue other meter-reading opportunities throughout Montana Power's service territory, offering other companies or cities cost-competitive meter reading and ability to provide their customers additional services through strategic alliances with MPC," Gannon said.
Under legislation passed earlier this year, Montana will begin to deregulate its electricity industry in July 1998.
